H0.text: Anatomical comparison is the method best suited to confirm that the rock layer has overturned by determining the ages of the fossils X, Y, and Z, where fossil Y lies between index fossils X and Z but the older index fossil Z is found above the others.

H1.text: Gene sequencing is the best dating method to confirm that the rock layer has overturned by determining the ages of fossils Y, X, and Z.

H2.text: Radiometric analysis is the best method to confirm that the rock layer has overturned by determining the ages of fossils Y, X, and Z, especially given that the older index fossil Z is found above the others.

H3.text: Fossil depth measurement is the dating method best to confirm that the rock layer has overturned by determining the ages of fossils X, Y, and Z, where fossil Y is found between the index fossils X and Z and the older index fossil Z is found above the other fossils.

A4.text: Carbon-14 dating is used to determine the age of bones or the remains of an organism.
